data.title: Charlotte Y. Martin Boathouse
data.meta_description: Each fall semester, the Gonzaga oarsmen and coxswains descend on their primary boathouse and water-training facility, the Charlotte Y. Martin Boathouse. This boathouse
data.text:
Each fall semester, the Gonzaga oarsmen and coxswains descend on their primary boathouse and water-training facility, the Charlotte Y. Martin Boathouse. This boathouse is situated just above the Upriver Dam on the Spokane River and is privately accessed by only the men's and women's rowing programs at Gonzaga. Once there, the team has 6,800 meters of undisturbed water up to the top of the river, and the same amount back to the boathouse. They compete with no other rowing teams or water traffic allowing for productive and uninterrupted strokes on the Spokane River. Additionally the river is extremely protected from wind and choppy water, making "bad-water" days virtually non-existent.

The boathouse is a short 12 minute drive east of the Gonzaga University campus. Typically, the team is able to make the most of this facility and the river until late February.

DIRECTIONS TO THE GONZAGA BOATHOUSE

Physical Address:

7200 E. South Riverway Ave

Spokane, WA 99212

From Gonzaga University:

Get on Hamilton Road heading South

Take a left on Trent heading East

Follow Trent about four miles to Park Road

Take a left on Park Road heading North

Follow Park Road North until it ends at the river

Go left one block and thru the gates to boat house

Once through the gates follow gravel road until you reach the boat house.

From I-90 from West:

Exit on 282 (Trent/Hamilton Exit)

At bottom of exit take a right onto Trent

Follow instructions above once on Trent

From I-90 from East:

Exit on 287 (Argonne Exit)

Head North on Argonne towards Mt. Spokane Park

Follow through four stop lights until you reach Trent

Take a left on Trent and follow about two miles

Take a right on Park Road heading North

Follow Park Road North until it ends at the river

Go left one block and thru the gates to boat house

Once through the gates follow gravel road until you reach the boat house.
